newsitem.title: USA: Shelby Williams says order backlog higher.
newsitem.headline: Shelby Williams says order backlog higher.

text.p: Shelby Williams Industries Inc said its unshipped orders backlog as of December 31 was up about 14 percent to $32 million from $28 million a year ago.

"We are optimistic about our performance in 1997," said Paul Steinfeld, chief executive officer. "In 1996, the hotel industry enjoyed its highest occupancy rates in several years, resulting in increased refurbishing activity."
The company, which makes seats for restaurants, hotels and other facilities, at year-end had no short-term debt. Long term debt decreased to $7 million, down from $8.8 million one year ago, he added.
